subject: Your daily e-mail from the BBC
body:
Tuesday, 01 May, 2007, 18:00 GMT 14:00 -04:00:Canada/Eastern














Search BBC Sport 













FOOTBALL




Live - Liverpool v Chelsea
Liverpool look to overturn a 1-0 deficit in the second leg of their Champions League semi-final.



 
Man City ban Barton after bust-up
Man City suspend Joey Barton for the rest of the season after the midfielder hits Ousmane Dabo in training.



 
Mourinho attack inflames Ferguson
Man Utd boss Sir Alex Ferguson reveals his disgust at Jose Mourinho's latest comments about Cristiano Ronaldo.








GOLF




Carnoustie will break Open record
This year's Open Championship at Carnoustie will take place on the longest course in the event's history.



 
Woosnam pulls out of Italian Open
Ian Woosnam will miss this week's Italian Open in Milan with his ongoing leg complaint.



 
Donald errors hand Verplank win
A three-putt proves costly for Luke Donald as Scott Verplank pounces to win the Byron Nelson Championship.








MOTORSPORT




F1 races still boring - Briatore
Renault team boss Flavio Briatore says changes aimed at livening up Formula One have not worked.



 
Toseland extends lead in Holland
James Toseland stretches his World Superbikes championship lead with a win and second place at the Dutch Grand Prix.



 
Button 'wants to stay at Honda'
Jenson Button has no plans to leave struggling F1 team Honda, according to his manager.








FORMULA ONE




F1 races still boring - Briatore
Renault team boss Flavio Briatore says changes aimed at livening up Formula One have not worked.



 
Button 'wants to stay at Honda'
Jenson Button has no plans to leave struggling F1 team Honda, according to his manager.



 
Toyota team boss will stand down
Toyota team boss Tsutomu Tomita will stand down at the end of June and be replaced by Tadashi Yamashina.








ATHLETICS




Back injury for Aikines-Aryeetey
World Junior 100m champion Harry Aikines-Aryeetey returns to London after suffering a back injury during training in the United States.



 
Mason jumps to shock win in Dakar
Germaine Mason wins the high jump at the IAAF World Athletics Tour event in Senegal.



 
Radcliffe not in GB marathon team
GB's marathon team for the World Athletics Championships is named but does not include Paula Radcliffe at this stage.








CYCLING




GB is top cycling nation - King
British Cycling boss Peter King says this country's riders are the best in the world and will be GB's best hopes of Olympic gold.



 
Under-fire Basso parts with team
Ivan Basso quits the Discovery Channel team after an investigation into his role in a Spanish doping scandal is reopened.



 
Di Luca up for Giro after big win
Danilo Di Luca is looking forward to challenging for glory in May's Giro d'Italia after victory in the Liege-Bastogne-Liege race.








FUN AND GAMES




Quotes of the Week
Sir Alex Ferguson gets lovey-dovey as Jose Mourinho lets rip about everything



 
Comment: Big Sam, big loss
Robbo on why Bolton could struggle without Sam Allardyce



 
Life as a West Jesmond WAG
The team captain's girlfriend reveals her "high-class" lifestyle
